meanings.definition: Of or relating to a substance that is weakly attracted by a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The paramagnetic material was slightly drawn towards the magnet.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the paramagnetic properties of the metal.
meanings.sent3: The paramagnetic paperclip couldn't resist the allure of the magnet.
meanings.sent4: Her personality was like a paramagnetic force, subtly pulling people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The paramagnetic effect was so faint that it required a sensitive instrument to detect.

meanings.sent1: The paramagnetic was placed near the magnet to observe its behavior.
meanings.sent2: Scientists have identified several paramagnetics in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous paramagnetic toy kept escaping the magnetic field.
meanings.sent4: His charm was like a paramagnetic, attracting attention wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The paramagnetic substance displayed its unique properties under the magnetic influence.
